intro: Cacalia tebakoensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Cacalia tebakoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has cultural significance in local communities.
